text: [29] showed that the use of real-time biofeedback in ASC has a positive effect on 'active meditation’practices with long-term focused attention. Body temperature is measured in two ways: skin and core temperature by contact LM35 precision sensor, connected to a high resolution logger and thermal emission in $8 – 1 4 \mu m$ areaby IRimaging sensor (NEDT $\leq \mathrm { \ f { ~ 6 0 m K } ~ }$ Both methods deliver the same temperature data,but differ significantly in terms of thermal dynamics: IR method requires open-skin regions that quickly cool down,while the contact method is best suited for measuring internal body dynamics.
